result.execSummary:
The defendant Da Vion Turner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cases 15CF334 and 15CM368 called together at 10:10am 
Defendant Da Vion  Turner in court, in custody  with Attorney Sylvie Helena Dahnert.  Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel has no disagreements with correspondence from Probation Agent

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance

On Case 15CM368, Count #3: The Court sentences Defendant to serve 2 months in Jefferson County Jail
On Case 15CF334, Count #2: The Court sentences Defendant to serve 3 months in Jefferson County Jail
On Case 15CF334, Count #6: The Court sentences Defendant to serve 3 months in Jefferson County Jail


--45 days credit for time already served given on Case 15CM368
--174 days credit for time already served given on Case 15CF334

The Court considers sentences to be time served. 

All outstanding costs/obligations are to be converted to civil judgment. 
recess:10:32am
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.
with criminal case settlement and elements

Cases 15CF334, 15CF340, 15CM314 and 15CM368 called together at 2:01 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Da Vion Turner in court, in-custody, with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #3-15CM368, Counts #2 & #6-15CF334 & Counts #1 & #6-15CF340; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses all remaining Counts in 15CM368, 15CF334 & 15CF340 and Case 15CM314

15CM368-Ct#3, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, concurrent, with conditions:
15CF334-Ct#2 & Ct#6, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
15CF340-Ct#1, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, concurrent, with conditions:
15CF340-Ct#6, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, concurrent, with conditions:
--serve 90 days in Jefferson County Jail (Ct#2-15CF334), with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence forthwith
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--No contact with Arriana Winters unless approved and authorized by Agent
--No acts/threats of violence
--No possession or consumption of alcohol
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--Complete certified batterer's Intervention Programming
--No possession of any dangerous weapon
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA Surcharges
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay pay domestic abuse surcharge (15CF334-Ct#2)

Days credit for time already served: 45 days-15CM368
Days credit for time already served: 1 day-15CF334
Days credit for time already served: 5 days-15CF340

Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Recess: 2:27 pm
Sent to Defendant (1)NOH for 12/1/15 Plea & Sentencing//Defendant in Custody at JCJ

Cases 15CF334, 15CF340, 15CM314 & 15CM368 called at 9:13 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Da Vion Turner in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

15CF334 & 15CF340:
Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Turner waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files informations

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered

15CM368:
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial DEMANDED by the Defendant

Court requires a $500 cash bond with conditions:
-No contact with Arianna Winter or Nicole Wellman
-No acts/threats of violence
-No presence at 218 N. Main St. Fort Atkinson
-Booking

15CF334 & 15CM314: On State's Motion to Modify Bond; Arguments by Counsel
Court presents basis and grants State's motion to modify bond and requires
a $1000 cash bond to cover 15CF334, 15CM314 & 15CF340 ($200 already posted) with conditions:
-no acts/threats violence
-no contact with Arianna Winters or Marissa Zache
-No possession or consumption of alcohol

SPEEDY TRIAL DEMANDED ON ALL CASES

case called at 1:38pm. [mo]
Defendant Da Vion Turner appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are NOT waived by the Defense; "not guilty" pleas entered on the misdemeanor charges

Atty. Dahnert notifies the court she will be filing a notice of alibi 
Atty. Dahnert requests that this case be scheduled with Case 15CM314
Upon agreement of Counsel, The Court re-schedules Mr. Turner's cases to 8:30am on 10/16/15

The Court requires a $1,500  signature bond, with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence towards anyone
--no contact with Arriana Winters
recess 1:45  pm. 


NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 10/16/15 at 8:30am
